page.title: 03KETTLEWELL, NORTH YORKSHIRE
page.content: There is a flourishing Youth Hostel, three hotels,a Post Office and general grocery shop, with a new outdoor pursuits equipment basement, a smaller grocery and general shop, a seasonal gift shop, a cafe, a working garage, several guest-houses, a travelling green-grocer and butcher, a mobile library and a branch of Barclay's Bank opening twice a week. A weekly surgery is held in the Village Hall. A chiropodist visits home-bound pensioners. There is a resident District Nurse and also a policeman whose beat is reputed to be the largest in England, covering 55,000 square acres. The nearest dentist is six miles away. The village water supply comes off Langcliffe pastures, though some of the inhabitants have their own water supply from springs.
